AppName.description: Readable name for an application. Must be unique within an organization.

AppId.description: System generated unique identifier for an application.

Record_string.never_.description: Construct a type with a set of properties K of type T

OrgId.description: System generated unique identifier for an organization.

deletedBy.description: Email address for the user that deleted the application.

createdBy.description: Email address for the user that deleted the application.

authConfiguration.description: Used to authenticate player requests. Use your own authentication or Hathora's Auth Client.

appSecret.description: Secret that is used for identity and access management.

Application.description: An application object is the top level namespace for the game server.

DeploymentId.description: System generated id for a deployment. Increments by 1.

TransportType.description: Transport type specifies the underlying communication protocol to the exposed port.

ContainerPort.description: A container port object represents the transport configruations for how your server will listen.

PlanName.description:
A plan defines how much CPU and memory is required to run an instance of your game server.

`tiny`: shared core, 1gb memory

`small`: 1 core, 2gb memory

`medium`: 2 core, 4gb memory

`large`: 4 core, 8gb memory

NumRoomsPerProcess.description: Governs how many [rooms](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#room) can be scheduled in a process.

env.description: The environment variable that our process will have access to at runtime.

additionalContainerPorts.description: Additional ports your server listens on.

defaultContainerPort.description: Describes the primary port your process listens on.

createdBy.description: Email address for the user that created the deployment.

requestedMemoryMB.description: The amount of memory allocated to your process.

requestedCPU.description: The number of cores allocated to your process.

buildId.description: System generated id for a build associated with this deployment. Increments by 1.

Deployment.description: Deployment is a versioned configuration for a build that describes runtime behavior.

Partial__card-CardPaymentMethod--ach-Ach.description: Make all properties in T optional

BuildId.description: System generated id for a build. Increments by 1.

BuildTag.description: Build tag to associate a version with a build. It is accessible via getBuildInfo().

regionalContainerTags.description: An alias for the container image in our regional registries.

status.description:
Status of creating a build.

`created`: a new `buildId` was generated

`running`: the container image is being built

`succeeded`: the container image was successfully built and stored in our registry

`failed`: there was an issue creating and storing the container image in our container registry

deletedAt.description: When the container image was deleted.

finishedAt.description: When the container image finished being built.

startedAt.description: When the container image starts getting built.

createdBy.description: Email address for the user that created the build.

Build.description: Build is a versioned artifact for a game server's container image and its data.

env.description: The environment variable that our process will have access to at runtime.

additionalContainerPorts.description: Additional ports your server listens on.

containerPort.description: Default port the server listens on.

DeploymentConfig.description: User specified deployment configuration for your application at runtime.

RoomId.description: Unique identifier to a game session or match. Use either a system generated ID or pass in your own.

LobbyVisibility.description:
Types of lobbies a player can create.

`private`: the player who created the room must share the roomId with their friends

`public`: visible in the public lobby list, anyone can join

`local`: for testing with a server running locally

LobbyInitialConfig.description: User input to initialize the game state. Object must be smaller than 64KB.

state.description: JSON blob to store metadata for a room. Must be smaller than 1MB.

createdBy.description: Email address for the user that created the lobby.

Lobby.description: A lobby object allows you to store and manage metadata for your rooms.

state.description: JSON blob to store metadata for a room. Must be smaller than 1MB.

TailLines.description: Number of lines to return from most recent logs history.

ProcessId.description: System generated unique identifier to a runtime instance of your game server.

Record_Partial_MetricName_.MetricValue-A.description: Construct a type with a set of properties K of type T

MetricName.description: Available metrics to query over time.

MetricsStep.description: Width of time in seconds to group data.

ExposedPort.description: Connection information to an exposed port on an active process.

egressedBytes.description: Measures network traffic leaving the process in bytes.

activeConnections.description: Tracks the number of active connections to a process.

roomSlotsAvailable.description: Tracks the number of room slots available on the process.

draining.description: Process in drain will not accept any new rooms.

terminatedAt.description: When the process has been terminated.

stoppingAt.description: When the process is issued to stop. We use this to determine when we should stop billing.

startedAt.description: When the process bound to the specified port. We use this to determine when we should start billing.

startingAt.description: When the process started being provisioned.

Process.description: A process object represents a runtime instance of your game server and its metadata.

RoomStatus.description:
The allocation status of a room.

`scheduling`: a process is not allocated yet and the room is waiting to be scheduled

`active`: ready to accept connections

`suspended`: room is unallocated from the process but can be rescheduled later with the same `roomId`

`destroyed`: all associated metadata is deleted

RoomAllocationId.description: System generated unique identifier to an allocated instance of a room.

RoomAllocation.description: Metadata on allocated instances of a room.

Pick_Room.Exclude_keyofRoom.allocations_.description: From T, pick a set of properties whose keys are in the union K

Omit_Room.allocations_.description: Construct a type with the properties of T except for those in type K.

roomConfig.description: Optional configuration parameters for the room. Can be any string including stringified JSON. It is accessible from the room via getRoomInfo().

Room.description: A room object represents a game session or match.

ConnectionInfo.description: Connection information to the default port.

ConnectionInfoV2.description: Connection information for the default and additional ports.

info.title: Hathora Cloud API
info.description: Welcome to the Hathora Cloud API documentation! Learn how to use the Hathora Cloud APIs to build and scale your game servers globally.

get.description: Returns an unsorted list of your organizationâ€™s [applications](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#application). An application is uniquely identified by an `appId`.

post.description: Update data for an existing [application](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#application) using `appId`.

get.description: Get details for an [application](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#application) using `appId`.

delete.description: Delete an [application](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#application) using `appId`. Your organization will lose access to this application.

get.description: Returns an array of [build](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#build) objects for an existing [application](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#application) using `appId`.
Get details for an existing [build](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#build) using `appId` and `buildId`.

post.description: Generate a new [build](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#build) for an existing [application](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#application) using `appId`. You can optionally pass in a `buildTag` to tag your build with a version. You need `buildId` to run a [build](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#build).

Provide a tarball that will generate a container image for an existing [application](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#application) using `appId`. Pass in `buildId` generated from Create Build.

delete.description: Delete a [build](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#build) for an existing [application](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#application) using `appId` and `buildId`.

get.description: Returns an array of [deployment](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#deployment) objects for an existing [application](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#application) using `appId`.
Get details for an existing [deployment](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#deployment) using `appId`.

post.description: Create a new [deployment](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#deployment) for an existing [application](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#application) and [build](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#build).

get.description: Returns an array of all regions with a host and port that a client can directly ping.

post.description: Create a new [lobby](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#lobby) for an existing [application](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#application) using `appId`.

get.description: Get all active [lobbies](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#lobby) for a given [application](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#application) using `appId`. Filter the array by optionally passing in a `region`.

parameters.description: Region to filter by. If omitted, active public lobbies in all regions will be returned.
parameters.name: region

get.description: Get details for an existing [lobby](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#lobby) using `appId` and `roomId`.

post.description: Set the state of a [lobby](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#lobby) using `appId` and `roomId`. State is intended to be set by the server and must be smaller than 1MB.

get.description: Returns a stream of logs for an [application](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#application) using `appId`.
Returns a stream of logs for a [process](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#process) using `appId` and `processId`.
Returns a stream of logs for a [deployment](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#deployment) using `appId` and `deploymentId`.
Get metrics for a [process](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#process) using `appId` and `processId`.

parameters.description: Available metrics to query over time.
parameters.name: metrics

parameters.description: Unix timestamp. Default is current time.
parameters.name: end

parameters.description: Unix timestamp. Default is -1 hour from `end`.
parameters.name: start

get.description: Returns an array of active [process](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#process) objects for an existing [application](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#application) using `appId`. Filter the array by optionally passing in a region.

Returns an array of stopped [process](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#process) objects for an existing [application](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#application) using `appId`. Filter the array by optionally passing in a region.
Get details for an existing [process](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#process) using `appId` and `processId`.

post.description: Create a new [room](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#room) for an existing [application](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#application) using `appId` and `region`.

get.description: Get details for an existing [room](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#room) using `appId` and `roomId`.
Get all active [rooms](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#room) for a given [process](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#process) using `appId` and `processId`.
Get all inactive [rooms](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#room) for a given [process](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#process) using `appId` and `processId`.

post.description: Destroy a [room](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#room) using `appId` and `roomId`. All associated metadata is deleted.
Suspend a [room](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#room) using `appId` and `roomId`. The room is unallocated from the process but can be rescheduled later using the same `roomId`.

get.description: Get connection details to a [room](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#room) using `appId` and `roomId`. Clients can call this endpoint without authentication.

tags.name: AppV1
tags.description: Operations that allow you manage your [applications](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#application).

tags.name: AuthV1
tags.description: Operations that allow you to configure authentication for your [applications](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#application).

tags.name: BuildV1
tags.description: Operations that allow you create and manage your [build](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#build).

tags.name: DeploymentV1
tags.description: Operations that allow you configure and manage an application's [build](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#build) at runtime.

tags.name: DiscoveryV1
tags.description: Service that allows clients to directly ping all Hathora regions to get latency information

tags.name: LogV1
tags.description: Operations to get logs by [applications](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#application), [processes](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#process), and [deployments](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#deployment). We store 20GB of logs data.

tags.name: MetricsV1
tags.description: Operations to get metrics by [process](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#process). We store 72 hours of metrics data.

tags.name: ProcessesV1
tags.description: Operations to get data on active and stopped [processes](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#process).

tags.name: RoomV2
tags.description: Operations to create, manage, and connect to [rooms](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#room).
